intro: Draba funckii, commonly known as the Funck's winter cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its low-growing habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically blooms in late winter to early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering plants in its habitat. Draba funckii has basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates.
